page.title: 12CUSTOMS
page.content: Customs in the Forest of Dean. Sheep Badgers.Visitors to the forest are surprised to see road signs warning of straying sheep. This custom has been questioned and opposed more in recent years with the increased road traffic.Persons born in the Forest can claim the right to graze sheep on the waste ground and grass verges of the roads. Permission has to be obtained from the Forestery Commission which is attempting to regulate the number of Badgers (owners)and number of sheep kept . Carnivals.The custom of holding an annual carnival has been revived in many towns and villages in recent years.A procession with marching bands, decorated floats and walkers usually start the proceedings.Cinderford probably holds the largest of these events.
